items.title: Bielle-Biarrey hat-trick denies Bristol top spot
items.summary: Bristol Bears miss out on top spot in their Champions Cup pool as Louis Bielle-Biarrey's hat-trick gives defending champions Bordeaux victory at Ashton Gate.

items.title: How Jones went from retirement plan to career-best year
items.summary: Britain's Francesca Jones was "very serious" about retiring in 2025. Instead, she enjoyed a career-best season and is now set for an Australian Open main-draw debut.

items.title: Ambitious Spurs eye Champions League spot after WSL rise
items.summary: A year ago, Tottenham lived in the shadows of a Women's Super League relegation fight. Today, they sit level on points with third-placed Arsenal after collecting 23 from 12 matches.

items.title: 'No-one says anything in your face' - Martinez hits back at Scholes and Butt
items.summary: Pundits discussing Man Utd "can talk on the television" but "no-one says anything" to your face, according to defender Lisandro Martinez.

items.title: How riverside walk & a nap set up Raducanu for dominant Melbourne win
items.summary: British number one Emma Raducanu overcomes a shaky start to sail past Thailand's Mananchaya Sawangkaew in the Australian Open first round.

items.title: Recharged Alcaraz starts career Slam bid with win
items.summary: World number one Carlos Alcaraz is "recharged" after a nine-week break as he bids to complete the career Grand Slam at the Australian Open.

items.title: Tearful Allen reflects on play-off loss to Broncos
items.summary: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen struggles to hold back tears as he reacts to their loss to the Denver Broncos in the NFL play-offs divisional round.

items.title: Olise shines as Bayern score five second-half goals
items.summary: Former Crystal Palace forward Michael Olise comes off the bench to grab a goal and three assists to help Bayern Munich fight back and beat RB Leipzig 5-1 at the Red Bull Arena.

items.title: Elvira beats Lowry and McIlroy to dramatic Dubai title
items.summary: Shane Lowry finds the water on the 18th hole as he misses out on the Dubai Invitational title to Nacho Elvira in a dramatic final round.

items.title: Elvira beats Lowry and McIlroy to dramatic Dubai title
items.summary: Shane Lowry finds the water on the 18th hole as he misses out on the Dubai Invitational title to Nacho Elvira in a dramatic final round.

items.title: 'Something lacking' about Liverpool - Van Dijk
items.summary: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk says there is "something lacking" about his side after they draw 1-1 with Burnley.

items.title: Broncos beat Bills in play-off overtime thriller
items.summary: Denver Broncos are one step closer to the Superbowl after beating Buffalo Bills 33-30 with an overtime field goal.

items.title: Walker scores hat-trick as Seahawks thrash 49ers
items.summary: Watch highlights as the Seattle Seahawks earn a resounding 41-6 win over the San Francisco 49ers, thanks to three touchdowns by running back Kenneth Walker III.

items.title: Champions Great Britain win opening SailGP round
items.summary: Title holders Great Britain take victory in the opening round of this year's SailGB championship in Australia.

items.title: Shaheed scores incredible touchdown on first play of the game
items.summary: Watch the moment Seattle Seahawks kick-off returner Rashid Shaheed scores a 95-yard touchdown moments into their NFL play-off divisional round win over the San Francisco 49ers.

items.title: Spurs chiefs consider sacking Frank as fans turn
items.summary: Tottenham head coach Thomas Frank is under significant internal scrutiny with the club considering calling time on his seven-month reign.

items.title: 'Luckily I grabbed her' - player helps ball girl after collapse
items.summary: Turkish player Zeynep Sonmez says it was "instinct" to help after a ball girl fainted during day one of the 2026 Australian Open.

items.title: GB's Fear and Gibson can win Olympic medal - but only if they are flawless
items.summary: With the 2026 Winter Olympics almost upon us, prepare to hear the names Fear and Gibson plenty over the coming weeks. But are they good enough to win an Olympic medal?

items.title: Hall wins Vic Open title on Australasia tour
items.summary: Wales' Lydia Hall took her fourth WPGA Tour of Australasia title with victory in the Vic Open at 13th Beach Golf Links.

items.title: Britain's Fery causes first upset of Australian Open
items.summary: British qualifier Arthur Fery claims another notable Grand Slam scalp by stunning 20th seed Flavio Cobolli on day one of the Australian Open.

items.title: 'I let team down' - Allen in tears as Super Bowl wait goes on
items.summary: Josh Allen endures more play-off heartache as Denver beat Buffalo while Seattle also move within one win of the Super Bowl.

items.title: Broncos quarterback Nix breaks ankle in play-off win
items.summary: Denver Broncos quarterback Bo Nix will miss the rest of the season after fracturing his ankle in Saturday's thrilling 33-30 play-off win over the Buffalo Bills.

items.title: 'The fans have spoken' - Why Frank's future at Spurs looks bleak
items.summary: Match of the Day's Mark Chapman, Alan Shearer and Wayne Rooney explain why they think Thomas Frank's time as Tottenham Hotspur manager is about to come to an end following his side's 2-1 home defeat to West Ham.

items.title: 'I'll be surprised if he's here next game' - Shearer on Glasner
items.summary: Match of the Day pundit Alan Shearer expects Oliver Glasner to leave Crystal Palace in the coming week, after his outburst against the board in the wake of their defeat by Sunderland.

items.title: How Carrick's Man Utd dismantled Man City
items.summary: Match of the Day pundits Alan Shearer and Wayne Rooney break down how Manchester United's shape frustrated Manchester City in Michael Carrick's first game as interim manager.

items.title: Missed opportunity for Arsenal - but were they denied 'clear penalty'?
items.summary: Arsenal have moved seven points clear at the top of the Premier League after a 0-0 draw at Nottingham Forest - but should the Gunners have been awarded a penalty?

items.title: NBA plans to 'tap into European football culture'
items.summary: NBA commissioner Adam Silver says he is looking make the most of existing football clubs in his bid to launch NBA Europe.

items.title: Chelsea make Jacquet move - Sunday's gossip
items.summary: Chelsea prepared to pay Â£43m for Jeremy Jacquet, Evan Ferguson wanted by Napoli and Bournemouth chasing Christos Mandas - Sunday's gossip.

items.title: Arsenal stumble in draw against resilient Forest
items.summary: Arsenal missed the chance to extend their lead at the top of the Premier League table to nine points, with a goalless draw against a determined Nottingham Forest.

items.title: Ruthless Man Utd beat Man City in dream start for Carrick
items.summary: Michael Carrick gets off to the perfect start in his first match as interim manager for Manchester United with a two-goal derby win against Manchester City, leaving Pep Guardiola's side winless in their past four matches.

items.title: Wasteful Liverpool miss penalty in draw against Burnley
items.summary: Liverpool missed countless chances, including a Dominik Szoboszlai penalty, as a Michael Edwards equaliser grabbed Burnley an important point at Anfield.

items.title: Last-minute Wilson goal leaves fans booing Frank's Spurs
items.summary: A last-minute Callum Wilson goal gives West Ham an important three points and increases the pressure on Tottenham boss Thomas Frank.

items.title: Brobbey goal earns Sunderland comeback win over struggling Palace
items.summary: Enzo Le Fee and Brian Brobbey were on the scoresheet as Sunderland came from behind to beat Crystal Palace, who are without a win in 10 matches in all competitions.

items.title: Super-sub Nmecha wins it for Leeds in stoppage time
items.summary: Substitute Lukas Nmecha scores in stoppage time to give Leeds an important win against Fulham, and leave them eight points clear of the Premier League relegation zone.

items.title: Chelsea beat Brentford for Rosenior's first Premier League win
items.summary: Cole Palmer scored a penalty to secure the a for Chelsea against Brentford and give Liam Rosenior his first Premier League win as manager.

items.title: Was this the day Spurs fans finally lost all faith in Frank?
items.summary: Was the dismal home loss to struggling West Ham the day Spurs fans finally lost all faith in head coach Thomas Frank, asks chief football writer Phil McNulty?

items.title: 'I might be back for a job!' - Wilson laughs off transfer saga
items.summary: West Ham United forward Callum Wilson made light of the uncertainty surrounding his future, as he reacts to scoring a dramatic stoppage-time winner against Tottenham at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.

items.title: Glasner 'feels abandoned completely' at Palace
items.summary: Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner says he feels his squad "are being abandoned completely" by the club's hierarchy.

items.title: Frank understands booing Spurs fans' frustration
items.summary: Thomas Frank says he has the backing of the club's hierarchy, but admits he sympathises with the fans who booed his side after a 2-1 loss at home to West Ham United.

items.title: 'Perfect' start for Carrick - how Man Utd ran Man City ragged
items.summary: Michael Carrick gets his interim spell as Mancheter United head coach off to the perfect start as they out-play their Manchester rivals at Old Trafford.

items.title: NASAâ€™s SpaceX Crew-11 to Discuss Space Station Science Mission
items.summary: After 167 days in space, the crew members of NASAâ€™s SpaceX Crew-11 mission will hold a news conference at 2:15 p.m. EST, Wednesday, Jan. 21, at the agencyâ€™s Johnson Space Center in Houston to discuss their science expedition aboard the International Space Station. NASA astronauts Zena Cardman and Mâ€¦
items.body: NASAâ€™s SpaceX Crew-11 crew returns to Ellington Fieldâ€™s Guppy Hangar in Houston on Jan. 16, 2026, from left to right is Roscosmos cosmonaut Oleg Platonov, NASA astronauts Mike Fincke, and Zena Cardman, and JAXA (Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency) astronaut Kimya Yui. NASA After 167 days in space, the crew members of NASAâ€™s SpaceX Crew-11 mission will hold a news conference at 2:15 p.m. EST, Wednesday, Jan. 21, at the agencyâ€™s Johnson Space Center in Houston to discuss their science expedition aboard the International Space Station. NASA astronauts Zena Cardman and Mike Fincke , JAXA (Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency) astronaut Kimiya Yui, and Roscosmos cosmonaut Oleg Platonov will answer questions about their mission. The crew members returned to Earth on Jan. 15, splashing down off the coast of San Diego, and arrived in Houston on Friday, where they will undergo standard postflight reconditioning and evaluations. NASA will provide live coverage on the agencyâ€™s YouTube channel . Learn how to watch NASA content through a variety of additional online platforms, including social media. Media are invited to attend in person or virtually. For in-person attendance, contact the NASA Jâ€¦

items.title: NASA Receives 15th Consecutive â€˜Cleanâ€™ Financial Audit Opinion
items.summary: For the 15th consecutive year, NASA received an unmodified, or â€œclean,â€ opinion from an external auditor on its fiscal year 2025 financial statements. The rating is the best possible audit opinion, certifying that NASAâ€™s financial statements conform with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles forâ€¦
items.body: Credit: NASA For the 15th consecutive year, NASA received an unmodified, or â€œclean,â€ opinion from an external auditor on its fiscal year 2025 financial statements. The rating is the best possible audit opinion, certifying that NASAâ€™s financial statements conform with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles for federal agencies and accurately present the agencyâ€™s financial position. â€œNASA has delivered a complete and reliable report of our fiscal operations, critical to our success for the Golden Age of exploration and innovation,â€ said NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman. â€œNASAâ€™s mission drives innovation in space exploration, scientific discovery, and aeronautics, pushing the boundaries of whatâ€™s possible. Our fiscal year 2025 budget fuels economic growth, drives the growing space economy, and keeps America first amidst increasing global competition.â€ The 2025 Agency Financial Report provides key financial and performance information and demonstrates the agencyâ€™s commitment to transparency in the use of American taxpayersâ€™ dollars. In addition, the 2025 report presents progress during the past year, and spotlights the array of NASA missions, objectives, and workforce advanced withâ€¦

items.title: NASA Develops Blockchain Technology to Enhance Air Travel Safety and Security
items.summary: Through a drone flight test at NASAâ€™s Ames Research Center, researchers tested a blockchain-based system for protecting flight data. The system aims to keep air traffic management safe from disruption and protect data transferred between aircraft and ground stations from being intercepted or manipuâ€¦
items.body: 3 min read Preparations for Next Moonwalk Simulations Underway (and Underwater) By Supreet Kaur In an era where data security is critical to aviation safety, NASA is exploring bold new solutions. An Alta-X drone carries a custom built simulated Unmanned Aircraft Systems environment payload for the new blockchain system tests. Credit: NASA/Brandon Torres Navarette Through a drone flight test at NASAâ€™s Ames Research Center in Californiaâ€™s Silicon Valley, researchers tested a blockchain-based system for protecting flight data. The system aims to keep air traffic management safe from disruption and protect data transferred between aircraft and ground stations from being intercepted or manipulated.  For aviation and airspace operations to remain safe, users need to be able to trust that data is reliable and transparent. While current systems have been able to protect flight data systems, cyberthreats continue to evolve, requiring new approaches. NASA researchers found the blockchain-based system can safely transmit and store information in real time.  Blockchain operates like a decentralized database — it does not rely on a single computer or ceâ€¦

items.title: Out of This World Discoveries: Space Station Research in 2025
items.summary: As Earth completed its orbit around the Sun to close out 2025, the International Space Station circled our planet more than 5,800 times. Serving as humanityâ€™s unique laboratory in space, the station has hosted thousands of experiments and technology demonstrations, advancing science in ways that caâ€¦
items.body: 5 Min Read Out of This World Discoveries: Space Station Research in 2025 As Earth completed its orbit around the Sun to close out 2025, the International Space Station circled our planet more than 5,800 times. Serving as humanityâ€™s unique laboratory in space, the station has hosted thousands of experiments and technology demonstrations, advancing science in ways that cannot be replicated on Earth. In 2025 alone, more than 750 experiments supported exploration missions, improved life on Earth, and opened commercial opportunities in low Earth orbit. The space station continues to drive innovation by enabling human exploration of the Moon and Mars, transforming medical research, deepening our understanding of the universe, and fostering a growing commercial economy. Read through just a handful of 2025â€™s innovative research achievements from the orbiting laboratory. 25 Years of humans researching in orbit The International Space Station photographed in 2000 by the Expedition 1 crew. NASA On Nov. 2, 2025, humanity reached a milestone of cosmic proportions: 25 years of continuous human presence aboard the International Space Station. Since the first crew arrived on Nov. 2, 2000, NASA anâ€¦

items.title: NASAâ€™s Crawler Preps for Artemis II Rollout
items.summary: NASAâ€™s Crawler-transporter 2 moves toward the Vehicle Assembly Building at NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida on Friday, Jan. 9, 2026. The crawler will transport NASAâ€™s SLS (Space Launch System) rocket with the Orion spacecraft to Launch Complex 39B ahead of the Artemis II launch which will jouâ€¦
items.body: NASA/Ben Smegelsky NASAâ€™s Crawler-transporter 2 moves toward the Vehicle Assembly Building at NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida on Friday, Jan. 9, 2026. The crawler will transport NASAâ€™s SLS (Space Launch System) rocket with the Orion spacecraft to Launch Complex 39B ahead of the Artemis II launch which will journey Commander Reid Wiseman, Pilot Victor Glover, and Mission Specialist Christina Koch from NASA, and Mission Specialist Jeremy Hansen from the CSA (Canadian Space Agency), around the Moon and back to Earth no later than April 2026. The crawler-transporters have carried the load of taking rockets and spacecraft to the launch pad for more than 50 years at NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. Each the size of a baseball infield and powered by locomotive and large electrical power generator engines, the crawler-transporters stand ready to keep up the work for the next generation of launch vehicles to lift astronauts into space; Crawler-transporter 2 in particular is integral to the Artemis missions. Image credit: NASA/Ben Smegelsky

items.title: Blooming Seas Around the Chatham Islands
items.summary: A vibrant display of phytoplankton encircled the remote New Zealand islands.
items.body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Blooming Seas Around theâ€¦ Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe ğŸ›œ RSS Contact Us Search January 10, 2026 At about 800 kilometers (500 miles) east of New Zealandâ€™s South Island, the sparsely populated Chatham Islands are rugged, remote, and often inconspicuous. In January 2026, however, a ring of bright green and blue swirls in the ocean put a natural spotlight on the far-flung specks of land. A bloom of phytoplankton â€”tiny photosynthetic organisms that become visible to satellites when their numbers explodeâ€”encircled the Chatham Islands in austral summer. Surface currents and eddies carried the floating organisms into intricate wisps and swirls. The VIIRS (Visible Infrared Imaging Radiometer Suite) on the NOAA-20 satellite captured this image of the display on January 10, 2026. The Chatâ€¦

items.title: NASAÂ Adds Two F-15 Aircraft to Support Supersonic Flight Research
items.summary: Two retired U.S. Air Force F-15 jets have joined the flight research fleet at NASAâ€™s Armstrong Flight Research Center in Edwards, California, transitioning from military service to a new role enabling breakthrough advancements in aerospace. The F-15s will support supersonic flight research for NASAâ€¦
items.body: 3 min read Preparations for Next Moonwalk Simulations Underway (and Underwater) Oregon Air National Guard ground crew guides one of the NASA’s newest F-15 aircraft onto the ramp at the agencyâ€™s Armstrong Flight Research Center in Edwards, California, on Monday, Dec. 22, 2025. The retired U.S. Air Force F-15s come from the Oregon Air National Guardâ€™s 173rd Fighter Wing and will transition from military service to support NASAâ€™s flight research fleet. NASA/Christopher LC Clark Oregon Air National Guard and NASA flight crew look out across the desert while awaiting the arrival of the NASAâ€™s newest F-15 aircraft from the Oregon Air National Guardâ€™s 173rd Fighter Wing to NASAâ€™s Armstrong Flight Research Center in Edwards, California, on Monday, Dec. 22, 2025 NASA/Christopher LC Clark NASA’s newest F-15 aircraft arrive at the agencyâ€™s Armstrong Flight Research Center in Edwards, California, on Monday, Dec. 22, 2025. The two retired U.S. Air Force F-15s will support ongoing supersonic flight research for NASAâ€™s Flight Demonstrations and Capabilities Project and the Quesst missionâ€™s X-59 quiet supersonic research aircraft. NASA/Christopher LC Clark NASA staff and Oregon Air Naâ€¦
